title: Google\Cloud\Batch\V1\AllocationPolicy
name: AllocationPolicy
description:
A Job's resource allocation policy describes when, where, and how compute resources should be allocated for the Job.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.batch.v1.AllocationPolicy

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.location
params.description: Location where compute resources should be allocated for the Job.

params.name: data.instances
params.description: Describe instances that can be created by this AllocationPolicy. Only instances[0] is supported now.

params.name: data.service_account
params.description: Service account that VMs will run as.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels applied to all VM instances and other resources created by AllocationPolicy. Labels could be user provided or system generated. You can assign up to 64 labels. Google Compute Engine label restrictions apply. Label names that start with "goog-" or "google-" are reserved.
